comments.author: pglpm0@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

When the Menu Bar is visible, middle-clicking on a link in any page does not do anything.

When the Menu Bar is invisible, the middle-click works as normal.

I tested this on a newly installed Firefox 5 with new profile (no add-ons, default settings). I also checked the configuration of my touchpad (which does have a real middle button).




Expected results:

The middle-click on a link should open it in a new tab or window independently of whether the Menu Bar is visible or not.
comments.creator: pglpm0@gmail.com

comments.author: andrei.domuta@softvision.ro
comments.text:
It works fine for me on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110630 Firefox/7.0a1, regardless of the menu bar visibility.

> When the Menu Bar is visible, middle-clicking on a 
> link in any page does not do anything.

Can you reproduce this on a clean Firefox profile? Thanks
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Profiles

comments.text:
Bug confirmed on Firefox 5.0 both with a clean profile (and new re-installation) and running in safe mode.

I'll maybe move to 7.0 then, or explore if there's something else causing this.
